page.title: 07LANDSCAPE _ Essendon
page.content: A variety of materials have been used for the buildings in Essendon _ flint, pebble-dash,wood,concrete and brick. Some of the houses in Essendon are quite old, and they have been used in different ways. The oldest houses in the village are number 57 Tiled Cottage (which was built in the 17th century) and Essendonbury Farm,which has been rebuilt. {ESSENDON HOUSE} Essendon House is one of the biggest houses in the village. Mr Dimsdale who owned it was often called Lord Essendon. He did a lot of war work. He had one son and a daughter and his ancestors were relatives of Henry VIII He moved to Spain where he died and the house was given to his son who could not afford to run it.The house became a Rectory as the rector was a wealthy man.
